result.execSummary:
The defendant Harwinder S. Chahal was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

supervisions.notes: Probation Review Hearing scheduled for January 8, 2016 at 01:15 pm.

miscConds.notes:
Pay all MANDATORY costs, assessments, surcharges, victim/witness surcharge, domestic violence surcharge, and supervision fees as determined by Dept of Corrections.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means. ANY CASH BAIL ON DEPOSIT TO BE APPLIED.
Provide DNA sample, pay costs and DNA surcharge.
Restitution is set at 0.

NO CONTACT with the victim, UNLESS requested by victim and then only with prior approval of agent or the court, except for phone and email.
3rd party contact for the purpose of time with child(ren) as approved by agent.
NO NEW LAW VIOLATIONS.

Attend and successfully complete  Anger Management and continued programming.
Parenting classes.

AODA and recommended treatment including random urine screens/Maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Attend and successfully complete treatment and counseling programs as deemed appropriate by agent.

timeConds.notes: STAYED pending a review in 1-8-2016 at 1:15 pm in Branch 38.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Harwinder S. Chahal

records.addlTxt: The court will modify to NO VIOLENT CONTACT ORDER, however, defendant may not reside at home until agent's approval.

Defendant Harwinder S. Chahal in court.  Benjamin Calvin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Probation Agent is in court.  Probation Status Review report filed and reviewed.  Defendant is compliant or mostly compliant with probation.  The remaining condition time is stayed.  Court found that further review is not needed.

Defendant Harwinder S. Chahal in court with attorney Rebecca M Coffee.  Elizabeth Longo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  CASE HEARD FOR BRANCH 36
  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by parties and the defendant.
The court sentenced the defendant to serve 90 days in the House of Correction, with credit for 1 day time served. 
The court STAYED sentence and placed defendant on probation with the WI Department of Corrections for a period of 12 months.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
-Serve 25 days in the House of Correction STAYED pending a review on 1-8-2016 at 1:15pm in Branch 38.
-Attend and successfully complete  Anger Management and continued programming.
-AODA and recommended treatment including random urine screens/Maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
-Parenting classes.
-Attend and successfully complete treatment and counseling programs as deemed appropriate by agent.
-NO CONTACT with the victim, UNLESS requested by victim and then only with prior approval of agent or the court, except for phone and email.
-3rd party contact for the purpose of time with child(ren) as approved by agent.
-Obtain/maintain employment.
-No contact with firearms.
-NO NEW LAW VIOLATIONS.
-Pay all MANDATORY costs, assessments, surcharges, victim/witness surcharge, domestic violence surcharge, and supervision fees as determined by Dept of Corrections.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means. ANY CASH BAIL ON DEPOSIT TO BE APPLIED.
-Provide DNA sample, pay costs and DNA surcharge.
-Restitution is set at 0.
-48 USC Section 922(g)(9) prohibits possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a misdemeanor crime of domestic violence.
RECEIVED & FILED: Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief; Pretrial Incarceration Credit; Memorandum of Conditions of Probation; Victim Impact Statement.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for January 8, 2016 at 01:15 pm.

The court is not in session this afternoon.  Case transferred to Branch 38, Judge Wagner' sCourt.

JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Harwinder S. Chahal in court with attorney Rebecca M Coffee.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
cab
Parties are in court for a final pretrial today.
Defendant wants to change his plea.
As to count 1:
 Defendant waived  rights and pled guilty.
Guilty Plea Questionnaire, Addendum to Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights and Elements of Criminal Offenses - received and filed.
Defendant examined as to his plea.  Parties stipulate to the facts of the complaint as a basis for a guilty plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Information.  Judgment of Conviction entered.
.
On motion of the state and pursuant to negotiations, court ordered the penalty enhancer,  "Use of a Dangerous Weapon" dismissed.
. 
Case adjourned for a sentencing date in Branch 36.
.
Jury date of 08/31/15 is vacated.
  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 21, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Received and filed:
Justice Point report.
cab

Court orders defendant to be monitored by JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY, to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.  No use or possession of illegal or controlled substances without a valid prescription. Comply with the No Contact Order. No firearms/Dangerous Weapons. Defendant to report to enroll in Justice Point by 12:00 PM on 7/7/2015.

Victim present in court requesting modification of the No Contact order.  Court modified the no contact order to allow for telephone and e-mail contact with the victim ONLY for the purposes of business and children. Defendant to have NO in person contact with the victim or the victim's residence. Court ordered a No Violent contact order with the children.

Defendant Harwinder S. Chahal in court with attorney Rebecca M Coffee.  William T. Berens appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Bail argued. No Contact Order argued. Case remains set for Final Pretrial on 8/20/2015 at 8:30 AM & Jury Trial on 8/31/2015 at 8:30 AM in branch 36.
Attorney Coffee & ADA Piotrowski in court. Defense counsel requesting case be set for a bail/bond hearing. Matter set for Bail/Bond Hearing on 07/07/2015 at 8:30 AM in branch 23.

Defendant Harwinder S. Chahal in court with attorney Rebecca M Coffee.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case heard off the record. Defense counsel requests case be set for Final Pretrial & Jury Trial.  Signed, Filed & Distributed, Agreed Upon Request for A New Court Date form. Parties are notified that effective August 1, 2015 this case will be reassigned per rotation to Judge Jeffrey Kremers, Branch 36 in Courthouse room 502. Case adjourned for Final Pretrial & Jury Trial.  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 20, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for August 31, 2015 at 08:30 am.

  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Harwinder S. Chahal in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Harwinder S. Chahal in custody.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge GRADY, Branch 23.  Pursuant to Misdemeanor Division Directive 99-01, defendant is advised this case is reassigned to DV COURT.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 17, 2015 at 08:30 pm.
